page.title: 07HISTORY OF WOOKEY HOLE
page.content: ALTHOUGH A FEW HOUSES IN WOOKEY HOLE DATE BACK SEVERAL HUNDRED YEARS, THE GREATER PART OF THE VILLAGE WAS BUILT BY A W.S.HODGKINSON, WHO BOUGHT THE PAPER MILL IN 1848. HE AND HIS SON BUILT HOUSES FOR THE MILL WORKERS,A SCHOOL,ANGLICAN CHURCH,AND A SOCIAL CLUB FOR THE VILLAGE. THEY APPEAR TO HAVE TAKEN A PATERNALISTIC INTEREST IN VILLAGE LIFE. SCHOOL SPORTS AND TREATS WERE HELD IN THE GROUNDS OF THEIR HOME, WHERE THE VILLAGERS WERE ALSO ALLOWED TO PLAY CRICKET. THE FAMILY OWNED THE PAPER MILL UNTIL 1951, AND PAPER CONTINUED TO BE MADE THERE UNTIL 1972, WHEN IT CEASED AS A COMMERCIAL OPERATION, ALTHOUGH HAND-MADE PAPER IS STILL PRODUCED ON A SMALL SCALE,MAINLY AS A TOURIST ATTRACTION.
